page.title: 07Recent past in West Ashby.
page.content: By the middle of the 19th Century the Village must have been self sufficient looking at the work force; Broker and Skin Dealer, a Toll Collector, Baker, Shopkeepers,Carpenter,Blacksmith,Beer house keeper,Cattle Dealer and Victua/ ller,Butcher,Shoemaker and Wheelwright At the end of the century there were also a Thrashing Machine Owner,2 Dress makers, a Market Gardner, Post Officer and Thatcher.Today some of the skills essential in the past are no longer necesary the combined grocery store and post office has been replaced by the supermarkets of the nearby town. The shop closed in 1974.Two restaurants offer their services, capturing passing trade, one also being an hotel.
